introduction: Trilogy of Terror (original title: Trilogia de Terror) is a 1968 Brazilian horror film by Brazilian film director/actor José Mojica Marins. Marins is also known by his alter ego Zé do Caixao (in English, Coffin Joe). The film consists of 3 stories adapted from the Brazilian TV series Além, Muito Além do Além (Beyond, Much Beyond the Beyond): O Acordo (The Agreement), A Procissao dos Mortos (Procession of Dead), and Pesadelo Macabro (Macabre Nightmare).01/ O Acordo (The Agreement)A mother is involved with black magic and offers a virgin woman to the devil in exchange for immortality for her only son. (40 minutes).02/ A Procissao dos Mortos (Procession of Dead)A poor laborer is the only man in one village with courage to face a group of guerrilheiros ("guerrilla ghosts") that appears at dawn. (28 minutes).03/ Pesadelo Macabro (Macabre Nightmare)A youngster is frightened by snakes and lizards in nightmares in which he is buried alive. (31 minutes).
